column4: I set "$fontpath = /usr/share/fonts/X11/..." in  /etc/vnc.conf but when I start vncserver it complains about missing "/usr/share/X11/fonts/" (that's a different path). What's wrong here?
whats wrong with setting   fontpath=/usr/share/fonts/X11/
nothing, I did that (except for the leading "$" from the used perl syntax in he conf file)
no i mean -- "$fontpath = /usr/share/fonts/X11/" instead of "$fontpath = /usr/share/fonts/X11/..."
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/VNCOverSSH?highlight=fontpath
That's what I added to /etc/vnc.conf
But that paths doesn't exist on my system. It's rather called /usr/share/fonts/X11
I'm running Edgy
well, whats what i mean, use that path there /usr/share/fonts/X11
the font lookup should be rather recursive and dig into subdirectories
Yes, I did that: I replaced every "/X11/fonts/" by "/fonts/X11("
dont guess, use the paths that exist on your system
On my system there's a path /usr/share/fonts/X11/ containing 100dpi and others.
the error msg vncserver gives m is: "Could not init font path element /usr/share/X11/fonts/misc/, removing from list!"
It's still looking i the wrong path.
hmm, there must be another declaration of $fontpath that either supercedes the one you specify or is appended on .. i'm not so sure
let's have a look at your /etc/grep.conf .. use a !pastebin to show us
There are only the lines from https://help.ubuntu.com/community/VNCOverSSH?highlight=fontpath (| sed 's/\/X11\/fonts/\/fonts\/X11/g')
i dunno, manually verify that the paths specified in $fontpath exist or that you provide symlink for those missing directories
symlinking did it.
/usr/lib/mozilla/plugins
